item.title: Fake Homebrew Google ads target Mac users with malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers are once again abusing Google ads to spread malware, using a fake Homebrew website to infect Macs and Linux devices with an infostealer that steals credentials, browser data, and cryptocurrency wallets. [...]

item.title: Microsoft previews Game Assist in-game browser in Edge Stable
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft has announced that Game Assist, its recently unveiled in-game browser, is now also available in preview for Microsoft Edge Stable users. [...]

item.title: Bitbucket services “hard down” due to major worldwide outage
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Bitbucket is investigating a massive outage affecting Atlassian Bitbucket Cloud customers worldwide, with the company saying its cloud services are "hard down." [...]

item.title: 7-Zip fixes bug that bypasses Windows MoTW security warnings, patch now
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​A high-severity vulnerability in the 7-Zip file archiver allows attackers to bypass the Mark of the Web (MotW) Windows security feature and execute code on users' computers when extracting malicious files from nested archives. [...]

item.title: Ransomware gangs pose as IT support in Microsoft Teams phishing attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Ransomware gangs are increasingly adopting email bombing followed by posing as tech support in Microsoft Teams calls to trick employees into allowing remote control and install malware that provides access to the company network. [...]

item.title: Criminal IP Teams Up with OnTheHub for Digital Education Cybersecurity
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Criminal IP
item.description: AI SPERA announced today that it has partnered with education platform OnTheHub to provide its integrated cybersecurity solution, Criminal IP, to students and educational institutions. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: Exchange 2016 and 2019 reach end of support in October
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft has reminded admins that Exchange 2016 and Exchange 2019 will reach the end of extended support in October and shared guidance for those who need to decommission outdated servers. [...]

item.title: HPE investigates breach as hacker claims to steal source code
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) is investigating claims of a new breach after a threat actor said they stole documents from the company's developer environments. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes Windows Server 2022 bug breaking device boot
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has fixed a bug that was causing some Windows Server 2022 systems with two or more NUMA nodes to fail to start up. [...]

item.title: Microsoft shares temp fix for Outlook crashing when writing emails
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has shared a temporary fix for a known issue that causes classic Outlook to crash when writing, replying to, or forwarding an email. [...]

item.title: TikTok is back up in the US after Trump says he will extend deadline
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: TikTok is back up in the United States after Trump announced today that he would extend a 90-day deadline for the company to find a U.S. purchaser. [...]

item.title: TikTok shuts down in the US as Trump throws the company a lifeline
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: TikTok shut down in the U.S. late Saturday night following the Supreme Court's decision to uphold the law that banned the company over national security concerns. [...]
